revised_title: Satellite-borne Measurements of Middle-atmosphere Temperature: Techniques and Advancements
tldr: This article discusses the various techniques and advancements in satellite-borne measurements of middle-atmosphere temperature. It covers the different observing methods, instruments, and technologies used to study the temperature field as a function of pressure, allowing for the determination of geopotential height and atmospheric motions. The article also highlights the importance of satellite technology in understanding and predicting climate change.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Atmospheric Science
